comprehensive_overview: OpenEXR is a high dynamic-range (HDR) image file format developed by Industrial Light & Magic (ILM) for use in computer imaging applications. It is used for the interchange of high-fidelity image data between different software applications.
core_features:
1. Supports high dynamic-range and floating-point pixel data
2. Can store multiple images, layers, and auxiliary channels
3. Lossless compression algorithms
4. Extensible metadata capabilities
5. Cross-platform and open-source
